awd_titl_txt: Characteristics of Cloud-to-Ground Lightning in the         Contiguous U. S.
awd_abstract_narration: The objectives of this research are to overlay lightning ground                 flash locations on two radar reflectivity patterns in Doppler                   derived motions.  This will provide a way to study the lightning                characteristics and locations with respect to high reflectivity                 patterns and vorticity centers in mesocyclones.  One hypothesis                 of charged separation in thunderstorms will be examined by                      determining if the lightning locations cluster near high gradient               dBz values, a region known to have high velocity updrafts and                   downdrafts.  In addition, an objective of this research is to                   examine the 1989 lightning/data for the contiguous United States.               This study will examine the variation of the peak current,                      polarity, and lightning flash densities as a function of                        geographical position and season.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
